Global COVID-19 cases exceed 2.5M mark while death toll rise to more than 174,000 tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735042 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/735042/global-covid-19-cases-exceed-2-5m-mark-while-death-toll-rise-to-more-than-174-000/story/ There are more than 2,500,000 persons infected with the virus that causes coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) while about 174,001 have died. The extent of the dire effects of the pandemic has moved an official of the UNÂ World Food Programme to warn of a humanitarian catastrophe. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 05:56:55 +0800
'Minuscule traces' of virus in non-potable Paris water - city official tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735041 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/world/735041/minuscule-traces-of-virus-in-non-potable-paris-water-city-official/story/ "Minuscule traces" of the new coronavirus have been found in Paris's non-potable water -- such as the supply used for cleaning streets -- but drinking water is at no risk of contamination, a city official said Sunday. Mga OFW sa Italy, nagre-repack at paghahatid ng relief goods sa kanilang mga kapwa-Pilipino tag:gmanetwork.com:news_story-735029 https://www.gmanetwork.com/news/news/ulatfilipino/735029/mga-ofw-sa-italy-nagre-repack-at-paghahatid-ng-relief-goods-sa-kanilang-mga-kapwa-pilipino/story/ Buhay na buhay ang bayanihan ng mga Pilipino sa Italy, kung saan ilang overseas Filipino worker (OFW) doon ang nagre-repack ng relief goods at inihahatid mismo sa kanilang mga kababayan na hindi makalabas ng mga bahay at apektado ang hanapbuhay dahil sa umiiral na lockdown bunga ng COVID-19. Wed, 22 Apr 2020 00:07:29 +0800
